文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: Creep tests were carried out on specimens machined from heavily cold-worked Zircaloy-2 sheet material in both the rolling (longitudinal) and thickness (short-transverse) directions.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: The texture of the sheet was such that the majority of grains had basal-plane normals oriented 30 deg from the sheet-normal direction, and was independent of the metallurgical condition.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: The creep tests were carried out in the range 100 to 350 C on both as-received (cold-worked) and annealed material.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: At high stresses (all temperatures) such that rupture occurred in under 1000 h, the longitudinal specimens showed higher creep rates than the short-transverse specimens.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: However, at lower stresses the texture had very little effect on creep either in cold-worked material throughout the temperature range investigated, or in annealed materials between 250 and 310 C.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: In annealed materials tested at temperatures below 250 and above 310 C the longitudinal specimens had higher creep rates than the short-transverse ones.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: The material exhibited strong dynamic strain aging which reached maximum intensity around 300 C.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_004_chunk3
证据片段: At temperatures below about half the melting point (below $6 5 0 \mathrm { { C } }$ for dilute zirconium alloys [13]) one would normally expect the value of the activation energy for creep to be below that for self-diffusion [14], that is, below 46,000 cal/mole [15].

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_004_chunk3
证据片段: The anomalously high values that were obtained with Zircaloy-2 between 250 and $4 0 0 \mathrm { { C } }$ during this investigation (Fig. 9) as well as by Holmes [16] are attributed to a solute-dislocation interaction.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_004_chunk3
证据片段: The anomalously high values that were obtained with Zircaloy-2 between 250 and $4 0 0 \mathrm { { C } }$ during this investigation (Fig. 9) as well as by Holmes [16] are attributed to a solute-dislocation interaction.

STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_004_chunk5
证据片段: A creep experiment on 23-mm diameter tubular specimens of Zircaloy-2 is described. The specimens are stressed biaxially at hoop stresses from 11 to 26 kgf/mm² at 260°C at three neutron flux conditions.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_004_chunk5
证据片段: The results confirm that fast neutrons increase creep rates at all the stresses tested, but thermal neutrons have no detectable effect.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_004_chunk5
证据片段: A method is described for correlating biaxial tubular and uniaxial in-reactor creep results for zirconium alloys and this is applied to cold-worked Zircaloy-2, cold-worked 2.5Nb zirconium, and heat-treated 2.5Nb zirconium alloys.
